Introduction for timed content.Message: Hello! We are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps reduce the impact of COVID-19 and encourages us to continue with our lives…but it also presents risks and dangers.
Introduction for timed content.Interaction message: Would you like to learn more about this tip?
Introduction for timed content.Interaction message if already completed: We know that you have already received this tip (well done!). Would you like to review it again?
Introduction for timed content.Message for negative answer: That's okay! You can always type "Help" at anytime if you need any support with your children. Chat to you later!

Default introduction.Message: We are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps reduce the impact of COVID-19 and encourages us to continue with our lives…but it also presents risks and dangers.

List of tips.Message: Here are 5 tips that can help you keep yourself safe online:

Option 1: Learn about the risks and dang.Message:
1. Learn about risks and dangers

• Adults targeting people for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
• Harmful content – like violence, hating women, hating foreigners, encouraging suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography
• Sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos.
• Cyberbullying from other people and strangers.

Option 2: Quick tech fixes.Message:
2. Quick tech fixes:

• Turn on SafeSearch on your browser to filter adult content.
https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/entertainment-search-engines/
• Set up parental controls.
https://www.internetmatters.org/parental-controls/
• Set up strict privacy settings on online apps and games.
 https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/social-media/
• Cover webcams when not in use.

Option 3: Create healthy and safe online.Message:
3. Create healthy and safe online habits:

You can also create healthy and safe online habits like creating device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).

Option 4: Maintain privacy.Message 1:
4. Maintain privacy

Keep personal information private, especially from strangers. – some people are not who they say they are!
Option 4: Maintain privacy.Message 2: Remember that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).

Option 5: Report and seek help.Message:
5. Report and seek help

Report to INHOPE Hotlines and IWF portals to get support if you experience online violence or other things that are not acceptable.

INHOPE Hotlines: https://www.inhope.org/EN#hotlineReferral
IWF portals: https://report.iwf.org.uk/en
Child Helpline: https://www.childhelplineinternational.org/

List of tips.Message for choosing another tip: Please select another number if you want to learn another way to protect yourself online:

Set of messages 1.Message: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Digital parenting is just like parenting in the real world. You have taken a BIG STEP to keeping your child safe online. Good for you!
